entry.title: Azerbaijan rejects Armenia‚Äôs proposal to mutually withdraw troops from the border

media:group.media:title: Azerbaijan rejects Armenia‚Äôs proposal to mutually withdraw troops from the border
media:group.media:description:
üìçGeorgia has been granted European Union candidate status, while Putin warns Armenia against leaving Russian-backed organizations. üìçAzerbaijan has rejected Armenia's proposal to mutually withdraw troops from their common border. üìçIn this week's Insights, host Eric Hacopian delves into Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev‚Äôs reason for calling early presidential elections. He also provides an end-of-year review of Armenia's economic performance in 2023. Link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z4lKPqKWjic üìçCivilNet visits the Armenian Malinois Project of search and rescue dogs enhancing Armenia‚Äôs emergency response capabilities. entry.title: High-profile Armenian POWs remain in Azerbaijan

media:group.media:title: High-profile Armenian POWs remain in Azerbaijan
media:group.media:description:
üìç32 Armenian servicemen were freed from Azerbaijani captivity after a deal with Baku, but many high-profile Armenian prisoners remain in Azerbaijan. üìçMinisterial Meeting of Landlocked Developing Countries opens today in Yerevan with remarks from Prime Minister Pashinyan on principles for establishing peace with Azerbaijan. üìçEuropean Council President Charles Michel says the EU urges permission from Azerbaijan for Nagorno-Karabakh refugees to return home. üìçThe Russian-backed Eurasian Development Bank expresses interest in the construction of Yerevan‚Äôs Ajapnyak metro station. üìçLink to latest episode of ‚ÄúMindful Leaders‚Äù featuring Teach for Armenia CEO Larisa Hovannisian: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yQfg2h0gYtg

media:group.media:title: Aliyev Buckles Under Pressure
media:group.media:description:
In this week's episode of Insights, host Eric Hacopian delves into Azerbaijan's recent release of 32 Armenian POWs and ongoing negotiations between Armenia, Azerbaijan, and the United States. Hacopian explores the strategic motives and objectives behind these developments while also providing an end-of-year review of Armenia's economic performance in 2023.

entry.title: Paws In Action: Training Dogs For Search And Rescue

media:group.media:title: Paws In Action: Training Dogs For Search And Rescue
media:group.media:description:
CivilNet is exploring the efforts of the Armenian Malinois Project, a volunteer search and rescue (SAR) team using Belgian Malinois dogs‚Äîthe first of its kind in Armenia. Led by Raffy Ardhaldjian, this nonprofit civic resilience organization is preparing its team for international certification to effectively respond to both natural and manmade disasters. Join us as we meet the volunteers and their dogs, who are preparing to save lives and enhance Armenia's emergency response capabilities.
